content.text: Work out \$1.45 as a percentage of \$72.50
Write the number five million, two hundred and seven in figures
Write these numbers correct to 2 significant figures
Without using a calculator, work out \(\frac{1}{4} \div \frac{2}{3}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a fraction
Rearrange this formula to make \(l\) the subject
The area of a square is \(42.5 \mathrm{cm}^2\), correct to the nearest \(0.5 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Calculate the lower bound of the length of the side of the square
Change the recurring decimal \(0.18\) to a fraction
You must show all your working
Describe fully the **single** transformation represented by the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}\)
A car travels at \(108\mathrm{km / h}\) for 20 seconds
Calculate the distance the car travels
\(y\) is directly proportional to the square root of \(x\)
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form
The diagram shows a sector of a circle with radius \(6\mathrm{cm}\) and sector angle \(72^{\circ}\)
The perimeter of this sector is \(\left(p + q\pi\right)\mathrm{cm}\)
Find the value of \(p\) and the value of \(q\)
Show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
Find the acceleration during the first 10 seconds
The total distance travelled during the \(T\) seconds is \(480 \mathrm{m}\)
The diagram shows the speed–time graph for the first \(T\) seconds of a car journey
The diagram shows a triangular prism
Calculate the angle between \(AP\) and the rectangular base \(ABCD.\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{OP}\) , in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\) , in its simplest form
Find \(\overrightarrow{OX}\) , in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\) , in its simplest form
In the diagram, \(OABC\) is a parallelogram
